self-help.name: The 7 Habits of Highly Effective People

self-help.introduction: Stephen R. Covey presents a holistic, integrated, principle-centered approach for solving personal and professional problems.

self-help.name: Rich Dad Poor Dad
self-help.author: Robert T. Kiyosaki
self-help.introduction: What the Rich Teach Their Kids About Money That the Poor and Middle Class Do Not!

self-help.name: Think and Grow Rich
self-help.author: Napoleon Hill
self-help.introduction: Napoleon Hill researched more than forty millionaires to find out what made them the men that they were.

self-help.name: How to Win Friends and Influence People
self-help.author: Dale Carnegie
self-help.introduction: To make friends, influence others and get them in our corner, it is important to know how to look after their ego

self-help.introduction: 21 Great Ways to Stop Procrastinating and Get More Done in Less

self-help.name: The 5 AM Club
self-help.author: Robin Sharma
self-help.introduction: Self-help book, in The 5 AM Club, Robin Sharma tells the story of a fictional artist, an entrepreneur, and a tycoon to explain the benefits of rising early every morning.

self-help.name: The Miracle Morning
self-help.author: Hal Elrod
self-help.introduction: How you wake up each day and your morning routine (or lack thereof) dramatically affects your levels of success in every single area of your life.

self-help.name: You Are a Badass: How to Stop Doubting Your Greatness and Start Living an Awesome Life
self-help.author: Jen Sincero
self-help.introduction: You are a Badass points out everything wrong with our daily choices. We live our lives doing what others tell us to do and what we think we are supposed to do.

poetry.name: Leaves of Grass
poetry.author: by Walt Whitman
poetry.introduction: A young English gentleman of means, Aubrey, is immediately intrigued by Lord Ruthven, the mysterious newcomer among society's elite. The young man soon discovers a sinister character hidden behind his new friend's glamorous facade.

poetry.author: Rupi Kaur
poetry.introduction: The Man Who Knew Too Much traces the activities of Horne Fisher and his trusted friend Harold March. Although Horne's keen mind and powerful deductive gifts make him a natural sleuth, his inquiries have a way of developing moral complications.

poetry.name: To the Women I Once Loved
poetry.author: Pierre Alex Jeanty
poetry.introduction: Idealistic young scientist Henry Jekyll struggles to unlock the secrets of the soul. Testing chemicals in his lab, he drinks a mixture he hopes will isolate - and eliminate - human evil. Instead it unleashes the dark forces within him, transforming him into the hideous and murderous Mr. Hyde.

shortStories.introduction: This is Oscar Wilde's tale of the American family moved into a British mansion, Canterville Chase, much to the annoyance of its tired ghost. The tale is rich with allusion.

shortStories.introduction: a story of a young man fighting his inner restlessness. His unnamed protagonist is a sensitive, poetic resident of the very Westernized St. Petersburg of the mid-nineteenth century

shortStories.introduction: As if Dracula had created the Best Blood Transfusion Award, or Nero the prize for Fire Fighter of the Decade, or Henry VIII for Wife of the Month. Wouldn’t any of these prizes be downright crazy? Well, that’s exactly why I’ve decided that I don’t want to win a Nobel Prize

shortStories.name: A Woman’s Kingdom
shortStories.introduction: A Woman's Kingdom presents the world of Anna Akimovna. She is the rich factory owner whom everyone depends on for work and charity. However, although she has everyone admiring her, she is lonely and unhappy. She longs to marry.

shortStories.name: What Christmas is as We Grow older
shortStories.introduction: Published from 1851 to 1853, Household Words featured as its main attraction during the Christmas season a lengthy short story penned by Dickens himself. During these years Dickens’s world view underwent a sea change, from youthful optimism to looming disillusion with the course of human affairs.

shortStories.name: The Gift of the Magi
shortStories.introduction: One dollar and eight-seven cents is all the money Della has in the world to buy her beloved husband a Christmas present. She has nothing to sell except her only treasure -- her long, beautiful brown hair.

shortStories.name: At Your Age
shortStories.introduction: At Your Age, a 1929 short story published in the Saturday Evening Post, contains all the trademark elements that F. Scott Fitzgerald's readers had come to expect by the end of the Jazz Age.

science.name: Earth
science.author: Carlowicz, Michael
science.introduction: From its origins, NASA has studied our planet in novel ways, using ingenious tools to study physical processes at work—from beneath the crust to the edge of the atmosphere

science.name: Physics Essentials For Dummies
science.author: Steven Holzner
science.introduction: For students who just need to know the vital concepts of physics,whether as a refresher, for exam prep, or as a reference,Physics Essentials For Dummies is a must-have guide.

science.name: Climate Change and Migration
science.author: Quentin Wodon
science.introduction: The book constitutes a unique and thorough introduction to one of the most discussed but least understood consequences of climate change and brings together experts from a multitude of disciplines such as geography, anthropology and law, providing a valuable synthesis of research and debate

science.name: Basic Engineering Mathematics
science.author: John Bird
science.introduction: A wide range of courses have an intake that requires a basic, easy introduction to the key maths topics for engineering - Basic Engineering Mathematics is designed to fulfil that need.

science.name: Organic Chemistry For Dummies
science.author: Arthur Winter
science.introduction: A plain-English guide to one of the toughest science courses around Organic chemistry is rated among the most difficult courses that students take and is frequently the cause of washout among pre-med, medical, and nursing students

science.name: Space, Time and Einstein
science.author: J. B. Kennedy
science.introduction: An enlightening introduction to the philosophy of time and space. J.B. Kennedy offers an introduction to one of the liveliest and most popular fields in philosophy - time and space - aimed specifically at a beginning readership with no background in philosophy or science.

science.name: The Politics of the Environment
science.author: Neil Carter
science.introduction: The Politics of the Environment continues to analyse the relationship between 'green ideas' and other political doctrines, the development of green parties and public policymaking, and environmental issues at international, national and local levels

science.name: Essentials of Ecology
science.author: Scott E. Spoolman
science.introduction: Essentials of Ecology presents introductory ecology in an accessible, state-of-the-art format designed to cultivate the novice student's understanding of, and fascination with, the natural world

science.name: Cell Biology
science.author: Robert M. Klein, George C. Enders
science.introduction: This book was an excellent refresher for anyone looking to review information for either their final course exam or for the USMLE Step 1.

science.name: Mathematical Physics
science.author: Bruce R. Kusse and Erik A. Westwig
science.introduction: This is an ideal text for upper-level undergraduates in physics, applied physics, physical chemistry, biophysics, and all areas of engineering. It allows physics professors to prepare students for a wide range of employment in science and engineering and makes an excellent reference for scientists and engineers in industry.

Art.name: Digital Colour in Graphic Design
Art.author: Ken Pender
Art.introduction: Complete, practical guide to handling colour graphics on the desktop for Mac and PC - from the scanning, creation and manipulation of images to processing for different colour output devices

Art.name: Drawing Cartoons & Comics for Dummies
Art.author: Fairrington, Brian
Art.introduction: A unique reference for creating and marketing original cartoons and comics. An original American art form, comics thrill millions of people across the globe. Combining step-by-step instruction with expert tips and advice, Drawing Cartoons & Comics For Dummies is a one-stop reference for creating and marketing original cartoons and comics

Art.name: Art of Drawing the Human Body
Art.author: Parramon
Art.introduction: The complete comprehensive guide to drawing the human body Professional advice and easy to follow techniques.

Art.name: Interior Design & Interior Architecture
Art.author: John
Art.introduction: In this comprehensive work, an international and interdisciplinary team of authors presents the essential aspects of the various fields of contemporary interior architecture and design. The project examples are illustrated with brilliant photographs and plans.

Art.name: Creative Photography Ideas
Art.author: Emanial
Art.introduction: This book sets out more than 40 creative techniques and subject ideas to help you produce innovative photographs

Art.name: Food Styling for Photographers
Art.author: Linda Bellingham and Jean Ann Bybee
Art.introduction: Food Styling for Photographers is the next best thing to having renowned food stylist Linda Bellingham by your side.

Art.name: Mastering Photoshop for Web Design
Art.author: Sven Lennartz
Art.introduction: an intuitive guide to color management, as well as detailed instructions on how to get the most out of paths and brushes.

Art.name: The Green Beauty Guide
Art.author: Julie Gabriel
Art.introduction: This book presents a problem and provides a resolution. It even lists a few diy beauty solutions for man, woman, and baby

Art.name: Pencil Drawing Techniques
Art.author: David Lewis
Art.introduction: Here is a really good book for the artist who wants to develop his or her pencil drawing abilities, whether it's to improve your preliminary sketch work, or to create beautiful pencil drawings complete in their own right.Pencil Drawing Techniques brings together six of today's best artists, all of whom are incredibly fine instructors as well.

Art.name: Decorative Knots
Art.author: Mario Begon
Art.introduction: The Ultimate Book of Decorative Knots is an amazing resource of both practical and ornamental knots - flat knots, braids, plaits, webbing, woven knots, knob knots, solid knots, netting and Turk's head knots in all their varieties.
